paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: 3–4% of African Americans older than 65 years
patients.phenotype: heart failure (HF) in the elderly Black community

individual_records.evidence_sentence: This implies that the Val122Ile mutation a potentially important cause of HF in the elderly Black community.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with a mixed phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: The penetrance is variable and low, especially in female carriers.
variants.population_frequency: 3-4% in African Americans older than 65 years
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is prevalent in specific ethnic groups.
key_quotes: The most common mutation in the United States of America (USA) is Val122Ile.
Fortunately, the penetration is variable and low, especially in female carriers.

patients.demographics: originates in the Northern part of Ireland
patients.phenotype: mixed phenotype with high prevalence of carpal tunnel syndrome

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala mutation is associated with a mixed phenotype.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation is noted for its association with carpal tunnel syndrome.
key_quotes: The second most common mutation in the US is Thr60Ala, which originates in the Northern part of Ireland and causes a mixed phenotype with high prevalence of carpal tunnel syndrome.

patients.demographics: endemic in certain regions of Portugal, Japan, and Sweden
patients.phenotype: late-onset presentation, predominantly hATTR polyneuropathy phenotype

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with late-onset hATTR polyneuropathy.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation is noted for its late-onset presentation.
key_quotes: Worldwide, Val30Met (pV50M) is the most common mutation with late-onset presentation, predominantly hATTR polyneuropathy phenotype and endemic in certain regions of Portugal, Japan, and Sweden.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
